intro: Teucrium pilosum, commonly known as hairy germander, is a perennial herb native to regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, hairy, and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from pink to purple, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Teucrium pilosum is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
